qas.question: Along which mountain range does the Cave of Windows lie?
Cuarenta Casas is thought to be a branch of which settlement?
Where did the Paquime seek refuge?
Which current native tribes are thought to be descendants of the Casas Grandes?

context: La Cueva De Las Ventanas (The Cave of Windows), a series of cliff dwellings along an important trade route, and Las Jarillas Cave scrambled along the canyons of the <a0_0>Sierra Madre<a0_0/> in Northwestern Chihuahua date between AD 1205 and 1260 and belong to the Paquimé culture. Cuarenta Casas is thought to have been a branch settlement from <a1_0>Paquime<a1_0/> to protect the trade route from attack. Archaeologists believe the civilization began to decline during the 13th century and by the 15th century the inhabitants of Paquime sought refuge in the <a2_0>Sierra Madre Occidental<a2_0/> while others are thought to have emigrated north and joined the Ancestral Pueblo peoples. According to anthropologist current natives tribes (<a3_0>Yaqui, Mayo, Opata, and Tarahumara<a3_0/>) are descendants of the Casas Grandes culture.
